head.title: Treasury Offerings And Other Debt Planned This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Offerings And Other Debt Planned This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and a two-year note being auctioned on Wednesday.

According to traders, at the close of the New York cash market on Friday the rate on the outstanding three month bill was 5.67 percent and on the six-month issue, 5.92 percent. In when-issued trading, the two-year note was offered at a price to yield 6.51 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Freddie Mac, $4 billion of new five-year reference notes. Goldman, Sachs & Co., Salomon Smith Barney and UBS Warburg.
Mutual Group Ltd., $150 million of senior notes, Baa2/BBB+/---. Prudential Securities.
Semco Energy Inc., $160 million remarketable or redeemable securities due 2008, remarketing date 2003, Baa1/BBB---. BancAmerica Securities. (Source: MCM CorporateWatch)
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX-EXEMPT
TUESDAY
Alexandria, Va., $55 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Maryland University Systems, $90 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Clark County, Nev., $200 million of bond bank bonds. Competitive.
Georgia, $277.8 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Chicago Public Schools, $107 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Huntsville, Ala., solid waste, $75 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Maricopa County, Ariz., pollution control, $144 million of revenue bonds for Southern California Edison. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Nassau County, $245 million of revenue-anticipation notes. Fleet Securities Inc.
New York State Environmental Facilities, $163 million of clean water and drinking water revolving fund. Goldman, Sachs.
New York State Mortgage Agency, $106 million of debt securities. J. P. Morgan Securities.
New York State Mortgage Agency, $67.8 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Inc.
Orange County, Fla., $112 million of certificates of participation. PaineWebber.
Philadelphia Industrial Development Authority, $67 million of debt securities for US Airways. Salomon Smith Barney.
Wisconsin Housing Development Authority, $85 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
